intro: Amoria bonannii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Amoria bonannii is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
